text.value: generate 200 div in current index.html file

To generate 200 div elements in an index.html file, you can do:
```html <!DOCTYPE html> <html> <head> <title>200 Divs</title> </head> <body>
<script> for (let i = 0; i < 200; i++) { const div = document.createElement('div'); div.textContent = `Div ${i}`; document.body.appendChild(div); } </script>
</body> </html> ```
The key points are:
- Create a basic HTML skeleton with head, body, etc.
- Add a <script> tag inside the body.
- Use a for loop to create 200 divs, setting the textContent to the index.
- Append each div to the document body using document.body.appendChild(div).
This will generate the 200 divs dynamically when the page loads.
You can also give the divs unique IDs, classes, styles, or other attributes inside the loop. And you may want to add CSS styles to control their appearance. But this shows the basic way to generate a number of divs in plain JavaScript.
